title: AIGP Event
description: AI Governance Proof (AIGP) event schema v0.3.0 â€” an open specification for capturing cryptographic proof of every AI agent governance action. Includes OpenTelemetry integration fields for native distributed tracing correlation.

event_id.description: Unique identifier for this event (UUID v4).

event_type.description: What happened. Uses UPPER_SNAKE_CASE RESOURCE_ACTION convention.

event_category.description: Event grouping (e.g. inject, audit, agent-lifecycle, policy-lifecycle, prompt-lifecycle, governance-proof, policy).

event_time.description: When the governance action occurred (UTC, ISO 8601, millisecond precision).

agent_id.description: The agent that triggered this governance action. Should follow AGRN format: agent.<kebab-name>.

org_id.description: Organization the agent belongs to. Should follow AGRN format: org.<kebab-name>.

policy_id.description: ID of the policy that was accessed or injected.

policy_name.description: Human-readable policy name. Should follow AGRN format: policy.<kebab-name>.

policy_version.description: Version of the policy at the time of this governance action. Point-in-time snapshot for audit.

prompt_id.description: ID of the prompt that was used.

prompt_name.description: Human-readable prompt name. Should follow AGRN format: prompt.<kebab-name>.

prompt_version.description: Version of the prompt at the time of this governance action. Point-in-time snapshot for audit.

governance_hash.description: SHA-256 hash of the governed content at the time of the action. This is the cryptographic proof. Must be lowercase hexadecimal (64 characters) when present, or empty string for events without governed content.

trace_id.description: Distributed trace ID for end-to-end correlation. When integrating with OpenTelemetry, this SHOULD be the W3C Trace Context trace-id (32-character lowercase hexadecimal). Also accepts UUID v4 or prefixed format.

span_id.description: OpenTelemetry span ID identifying the specific operation that produced this governance event. 16-character lowercase hexadecimal conforming to W3C Trace Context parent-id. OPTIONAL. When present, enables correlation between an AIGP event and a specific span within an OTel trace.

parent_span_id.description: OpenTelemetry parent span ID. 16-character lowercase hexadecimal. Enables AIGP events to participate in OTel span trees, connecting governance actions to the calling operation.

trace_flags.description: W3C Trace Context trace-flags. 2-character lowercase hexadecimal. '01' indicates the trace is sampled. Preserves OTel sampling decisions in governance records.

data_classification.description: Classification of the data involved. Four-tier model: public, internal, confidential, restricted.

template_rendered.description: Whether the policy was rendered with variables before delivery.

denial_reason.description: Why access was denied (human-readable). Present for DENIED events.

severity.description: Impact level for denial and violation events.

source_ip.description: IP address of the requesting agent or service. May be omitted or anonymized for privacy.

request_method.description: HTTP method or protocol action that triggered the event.

ingested_at.description: When the event was received by the analytics store. Allows freshness measurement.

metadata.description: Extensible object for domain-specific data. Implementations may add regulatory hooks, custom tags, or framework-specific metadata.

^ext_[a-z][a-z0-9_]*$.description: Extension fields. Implementations may add custom fields prefixed with ext_ without breaking schema validation.
